parse.title: List of international presidential trips made by Igor Dodon

text.*:
Official welcoming ceremony held for Dodon in Baku, June 2017.
Dodon with Dmitry Medvedev in Istanbul, May 2017
Dodon with Sergio Mattarella in November 2017.

This is a list of international presidential trips made by Igor Dodon, the current President of Moldova.

Contents

  • 1 Summary of Trips
  • 2 2017
  • 3 2018
  • 4 Future Trips
  • 5 List of State Visits hosted by Dodon in Chisinau
  • 6 References

Summary of Trips[edit]

Since he took office in December 2016 he has made:

  • One visit to Armenia, Belarus, Belgium, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Italy, Kyrgyzstan, Turkmenistan, the United Arab Emirates and Vatican City.
  • Two visits to Azerbaijan, Iran, Transnistria, and Turkey.
  • Twelve visits to Russia.

2017[edit]

A joint press conference of Dodon with Russian President Vladimir Putin; January 2017.
Dodon with Vladimir Putin during a Military Parade on Red Square in May 2017.
Dodon with Transnistrian President Vadim Krasnoselsky in Bender.
Country Areas visited Date(s) Notes
Transnistria Bender January 4[1] He had a working meeting in Bender, Transnistria.[1] He is the second Moldovan leader to visit Transnistria.[1]
Russia Moscow January 17[2] He paid an official visit to Moscow, Russia. It was the first official visit paid by a president of Moldova to Russia in 9 years.[2]
Belgium Brussels February 7 Met European Commission Vice President Antonio Tajani.[3]
Iran Tehran February 12[4] Met with the President of Iran Hassan Rohani.[4] Attended the Women’s World Chess Championship.[4]
Russia Moscow March 17 Dodon participated in a business forum.[5]
Kyrgyzstan Bishkek April 13 - 14 Participated in the meeting of the Supreme Eurasian Economic Council.[6]
Russia Moscow May 9 Participated in the 72nd anniversary of Victory Day.[7][8]
Turkey Istanbul May 21 - 22 Attended the 25th Summits of the Heads of State and Government of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation organization. Met with Greek President Prokopis Pavlopoulos, Bulgarian Vice President Iliana Iotova, Russian Prime Minister Dmitry Medvedev, and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.
Hungary Budapest May 25 Working Visit. Met with President János Áder.[9]
Russia Saint Petersburg June 1 - 3 Attended the St. Petersburg International Economic Forum.[10]
Azerbaijan Baku June 22 - 23 Met with President Ilham Aliyev.[11]
Belarus Minsk, Vitebsk July 12 - 16 Working Visit[12]
Iran Tehran August 5 Attended the Inauguration of Hassan Rouhani.
Turkmenistan Ashgabat September 13 Met with Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedow.[13]
Russia Sochi October 11 Attended the CIS summit.
Vatican City Vatican City November 4 State Visit.
Italy Rome November 4 State Visit.
Armenia Yerevan November 9-10 State Visit[14]
Russia Moscow November 12 Participated in the inauguration ceremony of Dimitrie Cantemir monument.
Russia Moscow December 26-27 Took part in the informal summit of Heads of State of the CIS.

2018[edit]

Dodon and Russian President Vladimir Putin in Sochi.
Dodon attending the 2018 FIFA World Cup Final in July 2018.
Country Areas visited Date(s) Notes
United Arab Emirates Dubai February 12-14 Working Visit.[15]Participated in the World Government Summit.
Germany Berlin March 1-3 State Visit.[16]
Azerbaijan Baku March 15 Attended the 6th Global Baku Forum.[17]
Russia Saint Petersburg April 28 Working Visit. Met with the Moldovan diaspora in Saint Petersburg.[18]
Russia Sochi May 14 Attended a summit of the Eurasian Economic Union.[19]
Russia Saint Petersburg May 23-27 Attended the St. Petersburg International Economic Forum as a guest.[20] Dodon also visited the Valaam Monastery.[21]
Russia Moscow June 14 Attended the 2018 FIFA World Cup[22]
Turkey Ankara July 9 He attended the inauguration of Recep Tayyip Erdoğan.[23] Met with Nursultan Nazarbaev.[24]
Russia Moscow July 13-15 Attended the world cup closing ceremony.
Greece Mount Athos August 13 Made a private pilgrimage to Mount Athos.[25]

Future Trips[edit]

Country Areas visited Date(s) Notes
Armenia Yerevan October 11-12 He will attend the Francophonie summit and the celebrations in honor of the 2800th anniversary of the city of Yerevan.[26]
France Paris November He will participate in the Peace Forum in Paris.[27]
Poland Warsaw December State visit.[28]

List of State Visits hosted by Dodon in Chisinau[edit]

Country Leader Date(s) Notes
 Belarus Alexander Lukashenko April 2018
 Macedonia Gjorge Ivanov July 16-18 2018 [29]
